node.title: Indian police charge local Amazon executives over marijuana trade
node.alt: A billboard advertises an Amazon sale in New Delhi as an autorickshaw and scooter pass underneath
node.description: Police estimate about 1,000kg of marijuana, worth about $US148,000 ($204,000), was sold in Indian via Amazon.
node.content: ["Indian police say they have charged local Amazon executives under narcotics laws in an alleged\u00a0case of marijuana smuggling via the online retailer.\u00a0", "Police in the central state of\u00a0Madhya Pradesh arrested two men with 20 kilograms\u00a0of marijuana on November\u00a014 and found they were using the Amazon India website to order and further smuggle the substance in the guise of stevia leaves, a natural sweetener, to other Indian states.", "State police said in a statement on Saturday that executive directors of Amazon India were being named as accused under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act due to differences in answers in documents provided by the company in response to police questions and facts unearthed by discussion.", "Police did not disclose how many executives were charged.", "The police, who had previously summoned and spoken to Amazon executives in the case, estimate about 1,000kg of marijuana, worth about $US148,000 ($204,000), was sold via Amazon.", "Amazon did not immediately respond to a request for comment.", "However, the company has previously said it was investigating whether there was any non-compliance by a seller.", "Indian authorities have in recent years intensified their efforts to crack down on illicit drugs.", "Many high-profile Indian actors and TV personalities have been under scrutiny from narcotics officials since last year.", "Reuters"]
